get.summary: Retrieves a collection of job change reasons.
get.description: Retrieves all job change reasons. Secured by: Staffing Actions: Change Job Date and Reason Scope: Staffing

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

Proposed Business Title is required.

The last filled date for the position is after the current date.

The position has been vacated by this worker.

There are other staffing or business title business processes that affect this business title that are effective after this date.

Worker has additional jobs. This task is not supported for workers with multiple jobs.

Worker is terminated and does not have a future hire.

post.summary: Creates a job change instance with the specified data.
post.description: Creates a job change instance with the specified data. Secured by: Change Job Scope: Staffing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

Change Organization is not part of the Change Job workflow definition for the proposed Supervisory Organization

Hiring restrictions are missing for the organization selected.

Organization is not accessible by the user.

Organizations with the following Organization Types are required: [req_org_types]

Proposed Organizations contains inactive Organizations.

Proposed Organizations contains multiple Organizations with Organization Types that are restricted to single assignments.

Proposed Organizations contains those with Organization Types that cannot be part of Change Organization Assignments.

Proposed Supervisory Organization is required.

Proposed supervisory organization is not valid. It will be made inactive after the event effective date. This will result in this position not having a supervisory organization.

Reason is not valid for the Job Change Event or the processing user is a \~Manager\~ and the Reason is not valid for \~managers\~.

Reason is not valid for the worker type (Employee or Contingent Worker).

Reason is required.

Supervisory Organization must be active.

The Proposed Organization assignments do not meet the restrictions defined for the Proposed Supervisory Organization.

The current position has a pending organization change or a completed \~Supervisory Organization\~ change effective after this date. Therefore, this position cannot have changes as of the effective date.

The date entered cannot be earlier than the earliest hire date.

The effective date must be after the date of the last completed Assign Pay Group change.

The effective date must be after the date of the last completed Change Organization assignment.

The effective date must be after the date of the last completed Matrix Organization change.

The effective date must be equal to or greater than the date the position was last updated.

The hiring restrictions for the proposed \~supervisory organization\~ do not allow this type of \~worker\~.

The proposed \~supervisory organization\~ is in a Hiring Freeze. It cannot be selected.

This position is in a pending Merit Event. The effective date must be after the pending Merit Event's effective date.

Worker has additional jobs. This task is not supported for workers with multiple jobs.

Worker is terminated and does not have a future hire.

Worker submitted is the processing user.

You cannot initiate this action because there are other pending actions for the worker that conflict with this one. Close any pending Staffing, Matrix Organization, Pay Group or Organization events before initiating this action.

post.summary: (End of Life Date: 2025-08-03 ) Validates allowed and required worktag types and worktag combinations so that you can correct errors before you submit transactions.
post.description: Validate the allowed and required worktag types and worktag combinations based on the configuration in the 'Maintain Related Worktag Usage' and 'Maintain Worktag Usage' tasks and related worktags so that you can correct errors before you submit transactions using web services. This method is a read-only POST that doesn't add data to Workday. Secured by: Manage: Related Worktags, Worktag REST API Scope: Common Financial Management, Worktags

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

Allow Built-in Worktags must be either true or false.

Duplicate worktag types are not allowed.

Taggable Configuration is required.

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

isForContingentWorker.description: Identifies whether the reason is allowed to be entered for \~contingent workers\~.

isForEmployee.description: Identifies whether the reason is allowed to be entered for \~employees\~.

managerReason.description: Identifies whether the reason is allowed to be entered by \~managers\~.

taggableConfiguration_aa8aaaaeca39100032.description: For REST API requests only. Usually the Taggable Type in the 'Maintain Worktag Usage' task that is used for the transaction. Examples: Customer Invoice, Accounting Journal, Expense Report. Exceptions are when the taggable type is Budgets or Time Tracking, the value needs to be either a budget plan structure or time entry template.

validationTypes.description: For REST API requests only. The validation types to include in the response. If this request parameter is missing or empty, all validation types are included in the response.

restrictions.description: For REST API requests only. Values that are validated for worktag types configured with 'Restricted To' values. Example: Company for a cost center configured with Restricted To Companies.

invalidRestrictionsForWorktags.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates invalid restrictions for a worktag configured with Restricted To values. Use the Worktag With Restricted To Values and Invalid Restricted To Values report fields to view the values.

onlyOneProjectOrPhaseOrTaskAllowed.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
onlyOneProjectOrPhaseOrTaskAllowed.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates that there is more than one worktag for a \~Project\~ in the request. Only one worktag type of \~Project\~, \~Project Phase\~ or \~Project Task\~ is allowed.

missingRequiredWorktagTypesForWorktags.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates that at least one worktag type configured as required in related worktags is missing. Use the Worktag With Required Worktags and Missing Required Worktag Types report fields to view the values.

allowBuiltInWorktags.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
allowBuiltInWorktags.description: When true, REST API requests can include values in the Worktags field that aren't configurable worktag types for the Taggable Type but are valid for validation purposes. Example: Supplier in Supplier Invoice.

nonAllowedWorktagTypesForTaggableConfig.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates that at least one worktag type sent in the request isn't allowed by the Taggable Configuration.

missingRequiredWorktagTypesForTaggableCo.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates that at least one worktag type configured as ‘Required’ for the Taggable Configuration is missing in the request.

nonAllowedInactiveWorktagValues.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates that at least one inactive worktag was sent in the request that wasn't allowed by the Taggable Configuration.

status.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
status.description: The status in the REST API response that indicates whether the worktags sent in the request have validation errors or not.

worktags.description: The worktags sent in a REST API request to be validated based on the configuration in the 'Maintain Worktag Usage' and 'Maintain Related Worktag Usage' tasks. Validations consider required and allowed worktag types, allowed values, and whether inactive values are allowed.

invalidWorktagCombinations.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates that at least one combination of worktag values aren't allowed with one another. Use the Worktag with Allowed Values and Invalid Worktag Values report fields to view the values.

missingRequiredWorktagTypesAfterDefaulti.description: When returned in a REST API response, indicates that at least one worktag type configured as ‘Required’ for the Taggable Configuration is missing in the request and not added by default from related worktags. Use the Worktag With Required Worktags and Missing Required Worktag Types report fields to view the values.

initiator_f48f5f155a4448758b8be033ecd99f.description: The \~worker\~ that initiated the business process.  Does not return \~workers\~ who are hired in the future. Please do not use this field in a condition rule for the initiation step of a process, as it will not return results. This is because there is no initiator designated until the process has started. The Initiator field only gets a value after the event is initiated (after the process is submitted). Use the Current \~Worker\~ field instead

subject_11c61172ead64041a04fc92c28a3b34e.description: The subject of this business process.

currentBusinessTitle.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
currentBusinessTitle.description: The business title for the \~worker\~ prior to this business process.  If there is no business title override, this field defaults to the job title or job profile name.

proposedBusinessTitle.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
proposedBusinessTitle.description: The new business title for the \~worker\~ as of the effective date.  If there is no business title override, this field defaults to the job title or job profile name.

employee_436f2afb755f100012528fe3effe001.description: The \~worker\~ requesting the paid time off.

unitOfTime_436f2afb755f100012528fdc5a960.description: This is the unit of time (hours or days) associated with the time off for this time off entry.

timeOffRequest_436f2afb755f100012528fd1e.description: Returns the Time Off Event which includes this Time Off Entry.

timeOff_436f2afb755f100012528fbfc62e0011.description: The Time Off for this time off entry requested (Example: Vacation Time Off for Salaried \~Employees\~).

units.description: The units entered for a time off request line item for all status'.  Excludes adjustments.

date.description: The date requested to be taken for a paid time off request line item.

subject_0cb6354752a84103b396a3d00b503568.description: The subject of this business process.

initiator_f3b51f13346543ba83122960f6c8a9.description: The \~worker\~ that initiated the business process.  Does not return \~workers\~ who are hired in the future. Please do not use this field in a condition rule for the initiation step of a process, as it will not return results. This is because there is no initiator designated until the process has started. The Initiator field only gets a value after the event is initiated (after the process is submitted). Use the Current \~Worker\~ field instead

effective.description: The date this business process takes effect.

due.description: The date the business process needs to be completed.

initiated.description: The date and time this business process was initiated.

unitOfTime_581c389cce1410000feacb26b51c0.description: Identifies the unit of time for which time off and accruals are tracked for the Time Off plan.

timeOffBalance.description: Returns the time off balance including pending events for the \~worker\~ and time off plan.  This report field should be used within Calculated Fields.

initiator_7f6d98c3e99344df800de3b5defa45.description: The person that initiated the event for this event record.

stepType_e351106ef7c14ce19def3e2a50eeb80.description: Returns the type of step being performed by the event record.

status_e00f98895a7b48e7a681a308f8b8ad71.description: The status of this business process step.

overallProcess_f06a97ddf4794a5c8ff063bd5.description: Returns the overall process for this event record. The overall process is the outermost process in a business process.

subject_9d3d194b5fe340cba946593757de5d10.description: Returns the subject of the business process this event record is part of.

due.description: Returns the due date for this step.

assigned.description: Returns the date when the event record was last updated on.

effective.description: The date this business process takes effect.

proposedOrganizations.description:
Contains the organizations with staffing behavior that are assigned to the position as a result of this event.
All staffing behavior organization types are included (company, cost center, region, custom organizations, fund, grant, program, gift, business unit).
